[{'created': '2018-06-13 18:18:08.000000000', 'message': 'replace unicode with six.text_type

The unicode class is removed in python 3 so when we try to run the
linter there we have an error due to an undefined name. Replacing
unicode with six.text_type makes the code work under both python 2 and
3 as well as passing the linter.

Change-Id: Idc896049eeb1fcd1f76983cd87791d7e29e3f8de
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
replace unicode with six.text_type

The unicode class is removed in python 3 so when we try to run the
linter there we have an error due to an undefined name. Replacing
unicode with six.text_type makes the code work under both python 2 and
3 as well as passing the linter.

Change-Id: Idc896049eeb1fcd1f76983cd87791d7e29e3f8de
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 16:46:27.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I5b41967df565f37987f69a92a29703a618c4c012
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I5b41967df565f37987f69a92a29703a618c4c012
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

to ensure changes to not break ci

commit_message:
allow full tempest fs020 more resources

Featureset020 is a full tempest run and it is
taking very long to complete due to tempest.
By giving this one job more resources the tests
will complete more quickly.

Related-Bug: #1758932
Change-Id: I0aa0463c9eca0d1f187ac552b9f98789d2e698e6

commit_message:
if Fedora is used and support == false, ensure yum install

Ensure yum is installed via the package module
if distro = Fedora and support_distro_check = false

Change-Id: Ieeb7905e7ef2389f6ef21b3e826e02d678495202

From the CI logs it seems that the job is trying to download master images right after undercloud install, we need to download queens images at that point.'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-06-15 08:27:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Furthermore i don't think the job is redeploying Queens containers? Look at latest logs at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574724/  -- all seems fine there, AFAICT Queens images are downloaded first for deployment, then master for upgrade. I think we probably overwrite containers-default-parameters.yaml during the upgrade, so it only contains master in the final state. But we preserve logs from both `prep containers` runs, and they look good to me. So i can't see anything wrong with the job. Feel free to ping me on IRC so that we can get on the same page."}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-06-15 08:46:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
add fs051,fs052 to use emit_releases_file.py

The upgrade job fs051 is not upgrading from
queens to master it's redeploying queens to queens
containers.  Use the emit_releases_file to ensure
the correct params are set.

Change-Id: I4fa05c8e4982670916823225e988aa92c58e70fb

commit_message:
trigger scen008 job when config changes

scenario008 is still listed as experimental, however
there is no reason not to automatically trigger
a check job when the config for the job changes.

commit_message:
DNM: testing, refactor new undercloud variables properly

There are several undercloud variables now
that have not properly been moved into defaults
which is creating some issues.  Note the use
of undercloud_undercloud_hostname vs
undercloud_hostname.  Refactor these in properly.

Change-Id: Ib137b0a0d57143d27fa271f72c8db99586fb922e

commit_message:
run inventory first

If we have to run inventory in collect-logs, it should
be done first thing so everything is executed against
all the nodes.

Depends-On: I85a2e76c4582e3a95f407e2d1edbf6051bf3525b
Change-Id: I46682fc126e31514af4aaca07e7f521ca042101e
Related-Bug: #1742528

commit_message:
tq/tqe gate jobs in ci.centos are timing out

The deployments in ci.centos for the gate jobs
are timing out in the deployment. Let's bump the
timeout by 20 minutes and see if that resolves the
issue.

Change-Id: I0904f43981d2c9074acca0028834338188b6f88f

commit_message:
log the vxlan setup ping test for multinode

We are not logging the pingtest result for the
vxlan multinode setup.  It would be easier to create
a proper elastic recheck query if the logging was
in place.

Change-Id: I6f346102255a3149b2910473ccc328268cc3d842

commit_message:
add a support check for the openstack version

Ensure that users are aware of the versions that are supported
with tripleo-quickstart.  If a version is not supported a user
will have to set a variable to turn off the support check and
acknowledging that support is not provided.  This is a more
elegent way to drop support than to remove code that can
continue to work.  We may get more community support this way.

Change-Id: Ib8e00dfc3c4057dbee56648bb9f0acade04a6427

commit_message:
Use setuptools==33.1.1 in leap upgrade-requirements.txt

Avoids using setuptools 34.x as using it can hit this bug
when packages are being upgraded:

https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/951

Pinning to setuptools==33.1.1 also aligns to the
global-requirement-pins.txt in newton-eol

Change-Id: Ib33b828751c5a36d61448d148c5941beb6827c73

The journalbeat shipper will now have a "journald" tag attached to it
which will then be used by logstash to identify items and add tags to

To accomodate this load the logstash config has been updated to better

The logstash grok files have been moved into the files directory which

commit_message:
Add persisted logstash queues and tag journalbeat

The journalbeat shipper will now have a "journald" tag attached to it
which will then be used by logstash to identify items and add tags to
them based on the systemd slice.

To accomodate this load the logstash config has been updated to better
handle blowback and scale according to the capability of the underlying
hardware.

The logstash grok files have been moved into the files directory which
was done to speed up the time it takes to ship files to a given host.
Originally the task used to copy these files was using the template
module however none of these files have anything templated within them
so there's no need to run them through the template engine.

Change-Id: I4f0e50ac491b595c0d276f6e7292d2c6e61baa22
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add fullstack testing for neutron-fwaas

Add a fullstack testing framework for neutron-fwaas.  This is a basic
first pass just to get the framework deployed; detailed non-plagiaristic
tests will be added after.  For more information on what fullstack
testing is, see:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron/tree/TESTING.rst#n213

Includes definition of fullstack job in new zuul syntax.

Co-Authored-By: Reedip Banerjee <reedip14@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I16cd2432606ef9aa6b7bf3e08efe82882e5585d9

commit_message:
Generate the hosts inventory for OVN migration based on roles

Prior to this patch, we were relying on overcloud node names to decide
where to run ovn-controller and ovn-dbs. This is a bad idea as names
can be anything.

With TripleO composable roles, the safest option would be to run
ovn-dbs everywhere where neutron_api was running in ML2/OVS and run
ovn-controller where OVS agent was. This patch is figuring that out
through tripleo-ansible-inventory output.

Change-Id: Ic053f5a1ae152d564bf9f0f052ee8c80de786313
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use duration of all workers for aggregate object_replication_time

Instead of reporting the fastest worker completion time as the
aggregate completion time in recon data, report the time elapsed
between the first worker start time and the final worker end time. This
makes the object_replication_time consistent with
object_reconstruction_time.

Change-Id: I1eb064cf300170b7f9a6554c6ec792cf5918bb95

commit_message:
Remove release-tools from Release Management

The Release Management Team has retired the
openstack-infra/release-tools repository, so it should no longer be
tracked as an official deliverable. Move it to the legacy
deliverables list.

Change-Id: Idd17c32bdc851d60d0c9b3815880d07b465418eb
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579185

commit_message:
make python3-first job commands look at template definitions

Look at the jobs inside the template definitions, if available, to
determine where branches might be specified.

Change-Id: I7eec82499887bddc63a1ad12f3d1f31b1d4d1083
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Make obj replicator config error messages more informative

If a bad value is supplied for replicator worker options
then have the ValueError message report the option name.

Also, do not confusingly report that the bad value is '0'
when in fact no value has been set.

Related-Change: Iad468610b66b1bce82ab23f158a6f20e97025216

Change-Id: I2eb18a22486ab04263c97e5440f939dd7a3005dd

commit_message:
use db utils from lib

The APIs our consumers are using from neutron.db_utils were rehomed into
neutron-lib with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540161/

This patch consumes them by removing the rehomed APIs and using lib's
implementation where applicable.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I7ee53bce917feae8e37bf278eb3121a5af47131c

commit_message:
Set configure_qemu to true to get qemu port range applied

With https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561784 we change the default
migration port range to '61152-61215'.
nova::migration::qemu::configure_qemu needs to be set to true that
the config gets applied via puppet-nova.

Change-Id: Iad4b392c9fe7426f2ce10a02fadd8b1aeee34ef6
Closes-bug: 1779820
Depends-On: Idadfc7b3507977f1385e846a48a734ed0e5f0a32

commit_message:
Add --roles to update run CLI command.

To provide a consistent upgrades/updates CLI,
the same --roles and --nodes argument is added into
minor updates  CLI command. The use of these two
arguments is mutually exclusive, either we specify a
set of nodes or controlplane roles in which the minor
update will be run.

Change-Id: I1971b19b28049c98697631d6b0e190bdda078fcb

we know for sure that the image activation won't be successful.

The change follows the Glance principles of failing early and tries
to provide as meaningful error messages to the end user as possible.

Co-authored-by: Abhishek Kekane <akekane@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Prevent taskflow creation in impossible import

This change prevents taskflow creation during image import in cases
we know for sure that the image activation won't be successful.

The change follows the Glance principles of failing early and tries
to provide as meaningful error messages to the end user as possible.

Co-authored-by: Abhishek Kekane <akekane@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: 1758943
Change-Id: Iaee2781d07f4c0afd4f886f0b30b523bd47f1058
(cherry picked from commit 0376185fb34a8cba3d8d705e579e08cddfb9316d)

commit_message:
[Unity] Return logged-out initiators

In current implementation, Unity driver doesn't return the targets which
connect to the logged-out initiators, which causes the zone manager
fails to clean up the FC zone.

The fix returns all the targets of specified initiators no matter they
are logged in or not.

Change-Id: I1438d0bd4a43e1813dfb0a6e9b3c4a177c2fee8f
Closes-bug: #1773305
(cherry picked from commit 1ef06d4a31c3010f170da20fcc823dd81e77c1a7)
(cherry picked from commit e8c223f1f9041a2204138ea587a25728c4dba6fd)

commit_message:
load neutron objects using neutron-lib

To access neutron objects we're moving to a dynamic plugin approach as
shown in the depends on and related patches.

This patch removes the imports of neutron.objects and uses neutron-lib
to load them instead. The remaining base object import will be addressed
later.

It also bumps neutron-lib up to 1.14.0.

Change-Id: Ia4f0c969ef90df369232a7cd6e0dee6598c1d60b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570060/

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 03:31:16.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure node is rebooted before enabling DPDK

In the PreNetworkConfig, the order of resources sent to os-collect-config
changed after introducing vhost user resource. The current order is
1. HostParametersDeployment
2. DpdkVhostGroupDeployment
3. RebootDeployment and EnableDpdkDeployment
Here the expectation is that RebootDeployment should be completed
before enabling DPDK, but since both are provided at the same time to
os-collect-config, DPDK is enabled first. The reson is RebootDepolyment
is having signal transport as NONE and EnableDpdkDeployment is moved
after reboot because of ovs2.7 change of restart vswitchd, when DPDK is
enabled. This is causing the a failure.
This patch modifies the order as below:
1. HostParametersDeployment and DpdkVhostGroupDeployment
2. RebootDeployment and RebootEnsureDeployment
3. EnableDpdkDeployment

Related-Bug: #1780014
Change-Id: I5db52d5dd833833c989532931baea8fac03f9cb7
(cherry picked from commit f9e099f218c4c5bcba5ae3daeabc7e15d75fe136)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure node is rebooted before enabling DPDK

In the PreNetworkConfig, the order of resources sent to os-collect-config
changed after introducing vhost user resource. The current order is
1. HostParametersDeployment
2. DpdkVhostGroupDeployment
3. RebootDeployment and EnableDpdkDeployment
Here the expectation is that RebootDeployment should be completed
before enabling DPDK, but since both are provided at the same time to
os-collect-config, DPDK is enabled first. The reson is RebootDepolyment
is having signal transport as NONE and EnableDpdkDeployment is moved
after reboot because of ovs2.7 change of restart vswitchd, when DPDK is
enabled. This is causing the a failure.
This patch modifies the order as below:
1. HostParametersDeployment and DpdkVhostGroupDeployment
2. RebootDeployment and RebootEnsureDeployment
3. EnableDpdkDeployment

Related-Bug: #1780014
Change-Id: I5db52d5dd833833c989532931baea8fac03f9cb7
(cherry picked from commit f9e099f218c4c5bcba5ae3daeabc7e15d75fe136)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-06 10:14:06.000000000', 'message': "Fix ordering of source/console installs

When the console is set to 'novnc', the install process
will conditionally install pip packages into the venv
when in developer mode. To detect this is checks for
'nova_get_venv | failed or nova_get_venv | skipped' which
is only present if the source-install has been done first.

This patch fixes the ordering so that the installation of
the venv is done before the console install.

Change-Id: I3fc4bba4398d5aec605cb3ba19ae482c72f94bca
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ordering of source/console installs

When the console is set to 'novnc', the install process
will conditionally install pip packages into the venv
when in developer mode. To detect this is checks for
'nova_get_venv | failed or nova_get_venv | skipped' which
is only present if the source-install has been done first.

This patch fixes the ordering so that the installation of
the venv is done before the console install.

Change-Id: I3fc4bba4398d5aec605cb3ba19ae482c72f94bca

commit_message:
Switch hive_enable_db_notification's default value

Make this change for CDH 5.13.0.

And do so, such that the user may...
* easily observe the new default value
* easily override the new default value

Change-Id: Ic2805ee0fb6bc2d96144e86b8a3f49beae3e1cef

I think we need to consider this scenario: 
1. Use cinderclient to create volume vol-1
2. Use cinderclient to create snapshot (snap-1) of volume vol-1
3. Use cinderclient to create volume vol-2 from snapshot snap-1
4. Unmanage vol-1,vol-2 and snap-1

commit_message:
RBD: support to get manageable snapshots

This patch adds the ability to get manageable snapshots to RBD driver.

Partial-Implements: blueprint ceph-list-manageable-volumes-and-snapshots
Change-Id: I2f979f445aeb2664c93c6810dcf2e82aed92a8cf

There are a lot of fixes here that are good, and I wish they were in separate patches to approve.  But I have to -1 this because sphinx warnings-as-errors is a part of the new PTI, and was widely discussed on openstack-dev [1] back in April.  I don't think we should go back on that unless we can document in the commit message a compelling reason why it is technologically infeasible for us to do so.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129853.html"}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2018-07-05 14:08:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25: -Code-Review

This patch also fix functional test, due to neutron out of date version
and setns() of pynetns doesn't return any open FD anymore [2].

commit_message:
[Gate] Avoid sphinx_build error and fix functional test

Sphinx version 1.7.5 is raised doc build failures. Maybe deps are not
suitable with current sphinx version.

This patch fixes functional test, due to neutron out of date
version and setns() of pynetns doesn't return any open FD anymore [2].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/128986.html
[2] https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/commit/2e7964f498f97da83774eedeb868f785a2a6d107

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Phuong An <AnNP@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I44c89a4637a6c6b10f374f83ff76fb1225b603b7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-06 12:11:20.000000000', 'message': 'Change default age of purge_images_table to 180

The `glance manage purge-images-table` is supposed to be used
only if really required due to OSSN-0075. And the advice is
not to purge any freshly deleted rows due to the possible
ID collision of still in use images. This change increases
the default of "age_in_days" to 180 from it's original 30 to
stress this out. User can still define smaller age if they
must.

Change-Id: Idb13288b72b31940a357fc9b11db2d6bcd396261
'}]
commit_message:
Change default age of purge_images_table to 180

The `glance manage purge-images-table` is supposed to be used
only if really required due to OSSN-0075. And the advice is
not to purge any freshly deleted rows due to the possible
ID collision of still in use images. This change increases
the default of "age_in_days" to 180 from it's original 30 to
stress this out. User can still define smaller age if they
must.

Change-Id: Idb13288b72b31940a357fc9b11db2d6bcd396261

commit_message:
Run tempest tests with stable branch

Tempest plugins are branchless so we need to make sure the test
suite work with both master and stable branches. This patch adds
a job for running tempest test with stable branch. We choose to
use py35 because py27 jobs will be deprecated soon.

Depends-On: Iecb701498a565c784ada1c7f4a4649912abdf26f
Change-Id: Ib4ae1b1968c3d35af58d0d99479a9cfd75b7450d

commit_message:
Create a new parent layer for multinode jobs

Redefine nodeset for multinode and singlenode jobs.
The previous nodeset would waste nodepool resources for running
singlenode jobs.

Change-Id: Ieeaad2ba641d995f2583fc5ba4141ab26002dc2b
Closes-Bug: #1780324

commit_message:
Overhaul ironic role

Removed unused variables when able and updated to the new ironic driver
definitions found here.

https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/admin/upgrade-to-hardware-types.html

The intention is to support the drivers via profiles, so the table from
the above link was converted to a dictionary.  This dictionary was used
as a source when combining / concatenating the various drivers for each
profile into a usable list.  The standalone logic was simplified.

Change-Id: I19553af41b5e669386b855209c61235bf37371f2
Closes-Bug: 1758351
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

commit_message:
new_release: go back in history and compute depth

make get_last_release() go further back in release history,
compute the depth at which it finds a release.

Properly increment feature version based on the depth at
which the last release was found.

Change-Id: I5880611a7d9005cee8fe4c2d7920f84d880eeeb8
Task: 22351

commit_message:
Use openstack.config for config and Session objects

The TimingSession functionality has been merged into keystoneauth. This
allows us to use the CloudRegion object to get the Session directly.

Change-Id: Ib4c9210e681a2d2d9c5fc40de2c3ede1a5003154

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 00:02:00.000000000', 'message': 'GoodnessWeigher schedules non-type volumes

If the GoodnessWeigher is configured to be the only active weigher within
the scheduler, it cannot schedule a non-typed volumed for creation. This
patch adds a safety assignement to the weigher stats generation to allow
for scheduling untyped volumes.

This patch safely assigns a dictionary data-type to "volume_type" in the
event that:

    weight_properties = {
        "volume_type": None,
        etc..
    }

Volumes created with a volume-type will not cause an exception and will
be scheduled with the volume-type and back-end as configured.

Closes-Bug: 1766966

Change-Id: I7bc77ab02154aee80282e54b19a242bdea0a78ec
Signed-off-by: Eric M Gonzalez <eric@awnix.com>
(cherry picked from commit 34d75ca1a6eea03bc0fe856bf1a63e7d8d60f024)
'}]
commit_message:
GoodnessWeigher schedules non-type volumes

If the GoodnessWeigher is configured to be the only active weigher within
the scheduler, it cannot schedule a non-typed volumed for creation. This
patch adds a safety assignement to the weigher stats generation to allow
for scheduling untyped volumes.

This patch safely assigns a dictionary data-type to "volume_type" in the
event that:

    weight_properties = {
        "volume_type": None,
        etc..
    }

Volumes created with a volume-type will not cause an exception and will
be scheduled with the volume-type and back-end as configured.

Closes-Bug: 1766966

Change-Id: I7bc77ab02154aee80282e54b19a242bdea0a78ec
Signed-off-by: Eric M Gonzalez <eric@awnix.com>
(cherry picked from commit 34d75ca1a6eea03bc0fe856bf1a63e7d8d60f024)

commit_message:
Remove release-tools configuration

Remove configuration specific to the now-retired
openstack-infra/release-tools repository and set its Gerrit ACL to
the common read-only one shared by all retired projects. In removing
the ACL, switch the ACL used by the release-test repository as it
shared this one previously.

Change-Id: Ib03e48b1771bd43502abf28f866b13a636506585
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579188

commit_message:
Make primary only and handoff only workers dump separate recon stats

...currently they overwrite each others stats so there is only
ever a partial set of stats in the recon file.

Related-Change: Iad468610b66b1bce82ab23f158a6f20e97025216
Change-Id: I4396baeb1f21fe23a8177a9a84a54ba1541ba276

commit_message:
tempest: mark test_port_association_many_bgpvpn_routes unstable

Until the test becomes reliable, marking it as "unstable" with this
annotation will prevent its failure from resulting in a failed tempest
job (this single test will be marked as "skipped").

Change-Id: Ib083ff266759c180912e5cfa865b8784bca6de9d
Related-Bug: 1780205

commit_message:
(queens) add container minimal check

fs037 scenario000 update job is gating
most of tripleo but not yet checking
or gating openstack/tripleo-upgrade

Note: this is a modified backport, as we make the job non voting
for now in Queens.

Note: Please merge this review prior to workflowing
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/569195/1/zuul.d/multinode-jobs.yaml

Change-Id: I84c44a4f3cbc7ff0b54b1f04746e285a0a2d575c

Yeah I tried to describe how the new api added suporrts the scatter canvas drawing and there is some new behavior associated with that.

Here is the response now, http://health.openstack.org/build_name/networking-midonet-grenade-ml2/test_runs?datetime_resolution=hour&start_date=2018-03-30T19:00:00.000Z&stop_date=2018-04-06T19:00:00.000Z

as you can see there are no unique datetimes supplied with these run_times. (2 comments)

I'm really sorry this took me so long to get to. Between having to re-familiarize myself with the code this touches and having some temporary work priorities change I haven't had much time to review this. (hence why I'm reviewing it late at night)

So this is a good start and the js rendering side looks good. The issue I see with the code right now is the data preparation on the python api side. We're not returning the proper data on the rest api for graphing the run times accurately. I've included some inline comments about how we should be doing the data preparation to generate accurate graphs.

Since it's late I'm not sure if my comments are clear or explain enough about what we should be doing. So if you need some assistance on how to do anything feel free to reach out to me. Either via email or irc, if I'm around I should be able to help more quickly now that I've taken the time to read through everything again."}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2018-04-25 13:42:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Workflow-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-25 21:18:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add run time graph for jobs

Motivation for this change:
  By adding the run time graph to the job's page it will raise
  awareness to users of changes in run times among jobs.

New behavior:
  A linear chart called Job Run Time is available in the jobs
  view. It gathers run_time data from the job_data objects provided
  by the timedelta given by the user in the Resolution drop down.
  As a result, only a linear run time line was drawn because scatter
  points didn't seem feasible without having to include the run_time
  property into the api._aggregate_runs method[1], which would result in
  a much larger payload and a large number of scatter points that I don't
  think would be readable. I didn't test this, but just my thoughts on
  that part.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-health/blob/26f188a1021d07e9afa532e7053a8bfd242947c9/openstack_health/api.py#L345

completes queens priority "Job duration graph in o-h" from:
  https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-queens-priorities

Change-Id: Ib5196d86b6b5efa0083d4aa4dd28f1fac3493560
'}, {'created': '2018-02-25 23:37:13.000000000', 'message': 'Add run time graph for jobs

Motivation for this change:
  By adding the run time graph to the job's page it will raise
  awareness to users of changes in run times among jobs.
  By adding the scatter graph to the job's page it can raise awareness
  of the run time deviation.

New behavior:
  A linear and scatter chart called Job Run Time is available in the jobs
  view. It gathers run_time data from the job_data objects provided by
  the timedelta in the response of /runs/key/<key>/<value> limited
  by the values in the resolution dropdown.
  An array property called 'run_times' was added to this response
  in order to support drawing the scatter chart on the canvas.
  Since there are no unqiue datetimes supplied with these run_times
  the same datetime of the timedelta object was used.

completes queens priority "Job duration graph in o-h" from:
  https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-queens-priorities

Change-Id: Ib5196d86b6b5efa0083d4aa4dd28f1fac3493560

Notes on wip:
  * frontend needs work, I saw a patchset that
    matt proposed here[1] and I copied some of the work there.
  * I got to work on this for one day, my team wants me to work
    on some other things so I'm pushing this up so I can continue
    it at home.
  * also need to update the commit message below
  * also need to add tests

Motivation for this change:
  By adding the run time graph to the job's page it will raise
  awareness to users of changes in run times among jobs.
  By adding the scatter graph to the job's page it can raise awareness
  of the run time deviation.

New behavior:
  A linear and scatter chart called Job Run Time is available in the jobs
  view. It gathers run_time data from the job_data objects provided by
  the timedelta in the response of /runs/key/<key>/<value> limited
  by the values in the resolution dropdown.
  An array property called 'run_times' was added to this response
  in order to support drawing the scatter chart on the canvas.
  Since there are no unqiue datetimes supplied with these run_times
  the same datetime of the timedelta object was used.

completes queens priority "Job duration graph in o-h" from:
  https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-queens-priorities

'}, {'created': '2018-06-28 17:54:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add run time graph for jobs

Motivation for this change:
  By adding the run time graph to the job's page it will raise
  awareness to users of changes in run times among jobs.
  By adding the scatter graph to the job's page it can raise awareness
  of the run time deviation.

New behavior:
  A linear and scatter chart called Job Run Time is available in the jobs
  view. It gathers run_time data from the job_data objects provided by
  the timedelta in the response of /runs/key/<key>/<value> limited
  by the values in the resolution dropdown.
  A dict property called 'numeric' was added to this response
  in order to support drawing the scatter chart on the canvas.

NOTE:
  * The db method get_run_times_time_series_grouped_by_run_metadata_key
    does not allow match_key to be the same as the group_by_key so
    additional filtering on the api side needed to be done in order
    to draw a graph for a single job.
  * The methods in run_aggregator were derived from [1] and [2]

completes queens priority "Job duration graph in o-h" from:
  https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-queens-priorities

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/370913/4
[2] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-health/blob/4db9a614711a2e52f9c827a9340e7ff7d1882751/openstack_health/test_run_aggregator.py#L70-L90
Change-Id: Ib5196d86b6b5efa0083d4aa4dd28f1fac3493560
'}, {'created': '2018-06-29 16:36:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add run time graph for jobs

Motivation for this change:
  By adding the run time graph to the job's page it will raise
  awareness to users of changes in run times among jobs.
  By adding the scatter graph to the job's page it can raise awareness
  of the run time deviation.

New behavior:
  A linear and scatter chart called Job Run Time is available in the jobs
  view. It gathers run_time data from the job_data objects provided by
  the timedelta in the response of /runs/key/<key>/<value> limited
  by the values in the resolution dropdown.
  The original response of this API call is wrapped in a 'data' property
  and the additional information to support drawing the scatter chart on
  the canvas is added to a new dict property called 'numeric'.

NOTE:
  * The methods in run_aggregator were derived from [1] and [2]
  * An experiment was done to see which implementation would
    result in the lowest load time and the results for the job
    'tempest-full' for 2 weeks and 1 month periods are as follows:
    - latest patch with 1 db call
        2.21s - 2 weeks
        3.40s - 1 month

    - older patch with 2 db calls
        7.86s - 2 weeks
        10.16s - 1 month

completes queens priority "Job duration graph in o-h" from:
  https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-queens-priorities

commit_message:
Add run time graph for jobs

Motivation for this change:
  By adding the run time graph to the job's page it will raise
  awareness to users of changes in run times among jobs.
  By adding the scatter graph to the job's page it can raise awareness
  of the run time deviation.

New behavior:
  A linear and scatter chart called Job Run Time is available in the jobs
  view. It gathers run_time data from the job_data objects provided by
  the timedelta in the response of /runs/key/<key>/<value> limited
  by the values in the resolution dropdown.
  The original response of this API call is wrapped in a 'data' property
  and the additional information to support drawing the scatter chart on
  the canvas is added to a new dict property called 'numeric'.

NOTE:
  * The methods in run_aggregator were derived from [1] and [2]
  * An experiment was done to see which implementation would
    result in the lowest load time and the results for the job
    'tempest-full' for 2 weeks and 1 month periods are as follows:
    - latest patch with 1 db call
        2.21s - 2 weeks
        3.40s - 1 month

    - older patch with 2 db calls
        7.86s - 2 weeks
        10.16s - 1 month

completes queens priority "Job duration graph in o-h" from:
  https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-queens-priorities

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/370913/4
[2] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-health/blob/4db9a614711a2e52f9c827a9340e7ff7d1882751/openstack_health/test_run_aggregator.py#L70-L90
Change-Id: Ib5196d86b6b5efa0083d4aa4dd28f1fac3493560

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary py27 testenv

The pyNN factors automatically set basepython unless explicitly requested otherwise.
Therefore, "testenv:py27" section are unnecessary and should be removed
as the recommendation from Stephen in [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580250/3/tox.ini@15

Change-Id: I07428041f70c68520c451589fc65cb586741b69b

commit_message:
Retry floating IP tests

test_server_attach_detach_floating_ip() has a test for server
add/remove floating IP that seems to be racy, add a retry loop
to let neutron and nova do their thing before calling it bad.

Change-Id: I999a0d7dae1706d746053bafb7ab4e3b791d0042

[{'account_id': 27715, 'date': '2018-01-24 17:46:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-01-24 17:46:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Add to_xml utility to helm-toolkit

Adds "helm-toolkit.utils.to_xml" which generates xml from a map
hierarchy.  This allows for example parameterizing xml configs in the
native helm way via a values.yaml interface.

Change-Id: Ide3d48a2974e45e48cef5aadee2fa0ee6b3f5a8e

[{'created': '2018-07-05 16:56:27.000000000', 'message': "Bind openshift-master to the public network

It's ok to bind the HAProxy configs for openshift-master to the public
address. This will allow users to access the cluster from outside the
internal network. Openshift nodes will remain bound to the internal
network.

Change-Id: Ib573758b515264d1dda90cc9de61f4fa6659dc7d
"}]
commit_message:
Bind openshift-master to the public network

It's ok to bind the HAProxy configs for openshift-master to the public
address. This will allow users to access the cluster from outside the
internal network. Openshift nodes will remain bound to the internal
network.

commit_message:
Store ODL logs to file

ODL is configured to log to console and then access the logs
via docker logs. Older logs are being deleted too fast. So
moving back to logging to file which is default setting in ODL
THT.
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/
master/puppet/services/opendaylight-api.yaml#L60

Change-Id: I29724cfb23e13c8293d1b7b4341cbd409ae1b7a6
Closes-Bug: 1779629

commit_message:
Collect OVN databases logs

This patch is changing the tempest-post-common.yml file to collect
the logs from the OVN database as part of the jobs run.

The patch also enhances the networking-ovn DevStack plugin to allow
configuring the OVN database log levels and sets the level to DEBUG in
the tempest runs to help with troubleshooting problems in the gate.

Change-Id: Ib83524c705d88d0232b03bc3dc320430d21249bd

commit_message:
Update local.conf.sample to match stable/queens

This patch is adjusting the local.conf.sample file to match the
stable/queens release. Without these changes, using the
local.conf.sample file to deploy devstack will fail.

Change-Id: I139c85f25980f66dd8e88fadd060f62aee2558dd

subject: Do not disable ipv6 on loopback interface for epmd
messages: [{'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-07-05 18:04:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-07-06 06:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\ncheck-rdo'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-07-06 08:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 18:04:20.000000000', 'message': 'Do not disable ipv6 on loopback interface for epmd

Currently, as discussed in [1], the Erlang Port Mapper Daemon requires that
the loopback interface supports IPv6 in order to initialize properly.
Without that, rabbitmq-server cannot start and deployment fails at step 2.

Until the startup behaviour of epmd is amended, do not disable inet6 support
on loopback device to workaround the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1780065

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/rabbitmq-server/+bug/1312507/comments/15

Change-Id: I200acaeaca15e47dc2e3b2462a6254e85477ffb0
(cherry picked from commit 93fb7f08b8e1915ef594192984574f4f9613ccb1)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not disable ipv6 on loopback interface for epmd

Currently, as discussed in [1], the Erlang Port Mapper Daemon requires that
the loopback interface supports IPv6 in order to initialize properly.
Without that, rabbitmq-server cannot start and deployment fails at step 2.

Until the startup behaviour of epmd is amended, do not disable inet6 support
on loopback device to workaround the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1780065

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/rabbitmq-server/+bug/1312507/comments/15

Change-Id: I200acaeaca15e47dc2e3b2462a6254e85477ffb0
(cherry picked from commit 93fb7f08b8e1915ef594192984574f4f9613ccb1)

Currently we have a few possible places for building package in
the job. It requires logic change in order to differentiate

commit_message:
Don't trigger repo injection if nothing was built

Currently we have a few possible places for building package in
the job. It requires logic change in order to differentiate
between injection cases.
build-test-packages role can run and not to build anything bc of
various reasons, in this case we need to avoid running
install-built-repo role, that's why we set compressed_gating_repo
to empty string and check in every case if it's empty or not.
If compressed_gating_repo is emptry - we didn't built *last* time
anything, so nothing should run.
See also: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576277/1

Change-Id: I7d768c5b550984cdd45d8a9cbbf89767e5e1c418

commit_message:
Allow configuration of NFS backend for Nova

Allow NFS configuration of storage backend for Nova.
This way the instances files will be stored on a shared
NFS storage.

Implements: bp tripleo-nova-nfs

Depends-On: Id15aec6324814a871e87f19f24999b0e3b8a8f05

Change-Id: Ie4fe217bd119b638f42c682d21572547f02f17b2
(cherry picked from commit 6b6ae966ba7880787d0584d7e8304e5d6c9c0093)

commit_message:
Ensure Octavia created load balancer can be found

Until Octavia support for gets with filters is fixed, we need to
ensure we can find previously created Octavia LBs to avoid getting
InternalServerError from Octavia when executing the list function
with filters. Otherwise this will crash the lbaasv2 handler, and
after a few retries, it will also crash the kuryr-controller

Closes-Bug: 1778516
Change-Id: I10494b142803d8c32e09f970ecc4e87e68f2ebca

commit_message:
Support same projects in different domain

Getting 500 error when there are same project name
in different domain.
Selecting one domain from service_credentials.
e.g. services(or service) projects are in default and service_domain
having differrent id. so this selects default's services project
instead of service_domain's services project

Change-Id: I3f12811684a49794bca87c4a10b18d45879da773
Closes-Bug: #1776375

commit_message:
setup.cfg: remove qinling console script

Individual qinling client is not ready yet as there isn't a
qinlingclient.shell module. This commit removes the entry from
setup.cfg to avoid a useless qinling console script being created.

Change-Id: Id456890bb180a692f74b8a4a858128ed6519a7de

commit_message:
Use HostAddressOpt for opts that accept IP and hostnames

The change [1] that added support for ``HostAddressOpt`` type was
merged in Ocata and became available for use with oslo version 3.22.
This patch changes the opt type of configuration options to use
this more relevant opt type - HostAddressOpt.

[1] I77bdb64b7e6e56ce761d76696bc4448a9bd325eb

Change-Id: I747f94cef06a037d19147b6c64f03c1ce08c8043

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-06 22:54:34.000000000', 'message': "ignore linter error for 'long' type

The Python 2 type 'long' does not exist under python 3. The runtime
check for the python version is already doing the right thing, but the
linter does not honor that check so tell it to ignore the line.

Change-Id: If7d49f043da01f94e9d18df7ef81c96ca08bd025
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
ignore linter error for 'long' type

The Python 2 type 'long' does not exist under python 3. The runtime
check for the python version is already doing the right thing, but the
linter does not honor that check so tell it to ignore the line.

Change-Id: If7d49f043da01f94e9d18df7ef81c96ca08bd025
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'created': '2018-06-19 12:51:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix assert error during queue creating in ut

In some concurrent test case, the queue may be created
more than one time in the setup function. Since the queue
in Zaqar is lazy, it returns 201 or 204 in this case.

This fixes some additional tests that weren't covered in
commit 8e0dd9763aba67bb7094cf92312daeba8d087866.

commit_message:
Fix assert error during queue creating in ut

In some concurrent test case, the queue may be created
more than one time in the setup function. Since the queue
in Zaqar is lazy, it returns 201 or 204 in this case.

This fixes some additional tests that weren't covered in
commit 8e0dd9763aba67bb7094cf92312daeba8d087866.

Change-Id: Iec341c83cdd28d6db50b2e456d082431a62846af
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Goirand <zigo@debian.org>
Closes-Bug: #1777645

Or the function_version of a webhook would be changed to the default
value when updating the webhook without providing the function_version

Signed-off-by: Hunt Xu <mhuntxu@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Remove default function_version in webhook resource def

Or the function_version of a webhook would be changed to the default
value when updating the webhook without providing the function_version
parameter. That's an unexpected result.

Story: 2002898
Task: 22862

Change-Id: I63ec211a8771a55d2b04caed1f66a405849cb201
Signed-off-by: Hunt Xu <mhuntxu@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add network-create to python-zunclient

This change adds network create support to the python-zunclient project
for the network-create command.

The zun command network-create is now:
    zun network-create --neutron-net <neutron_net> --name <name>

Change-Id: I2b1e21b098dabf668f37558a2e7c2cc776002b9c

subject: Pin get-pip.py to 3.2
messages: [{'account_id': 28614, 'date': '2018-07-05 15:59:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-07-06 02:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2018-07-06 10:05:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 15:59:03.000000000', 'message': "Pin get-pip.py to 3.2

As get-pip.py evolves based on pip 10, while we're still using
pip 9, changes in the way it can be used are causing problems.

For example, the ability to use --download is no longer there.

As such, let's pin to a known good version and leave it at that
until we no longer need to use this script. Version 3.2 maps to
pip 7.1.2 which fulfills our needs.

Change-Id: I43ee210311daf206bd7586eaf8592809d8c38678
"}]
commit_message:
Pin get-pip.py to 3.2

As get-pip.py evolves based on pip 10, while we're still using
pip 9, changes in the way it can be used are causing problems.

For example, the ability to use --download is no longer there.

As such, let's pin to a known good version and leave it at that
until we no longer need to use this script. Version 3.2 maps to
pip 7.1.2 which fulfills our needs.

Change-Id: I43ee210311daf206bd7586eaf8592809d8c38678

commit_message:
Fix `def _admin` keystone client factory with trust scope

When trust_id is defined, the factory is adding None
value for all project scope keys in kwargs to avoid
this auth parameters will be loaded from auth conf.
This patch add None value for missing domain scope
keys domain_id and domain_name too.

Change-Id: If7dd2e171178d8408ec9802671198c9cf74707e1
Closes-Bug: #1763327

subject: tasks: tempest_install: Add conditional for PIP package installation
messages: [{'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-07-05 17:28:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-05 18:10:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-07-05 18:54:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-06 06:49:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck tempest test failure'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 17:28:57.000000000', 'message': 'tasks: tempest_install: Add conditional for PIP package installation

SUSE and CentOS use an empty list for the required PIP packages and this
breaks the role as follows:

fatal: [aio1_utility_container-efed904e]: FAILED! => {"attempts": 5, "changed": false, "cmd": "/usr/bin/pip2 install -U  ", "msg":
"\n:stderr: ERROR: You must give at least one requirement to install (see \"pip help install\")\n"}

As such, we need to check if the list is empty before we try to install
the PIP packages.

Change-Id: I67d54fafdbecc7d55de55cd30163105b6a997dac
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
'}]
commit_message:
tasks: tempest_install: Add conditional for PIP package installation

SUSE and CentOS use an empty list for the required PIP packages and this
breaks the role as follows:

fatal: [aio1_utility_container-efed904e]: FAILED! => {"attempts": 5, "changed": false, "cmd": "/usr/bin/pip2 install -U  ", "msg":
"\n:stderr: ERROR: You must give at least one requirement to install (see \"pip help install\")\n"}

As such, we need to check if the list is empty before we try to install
the PIP packages.

Change-Id: I67d54fafdbecc7d55de55cd30163105b6a997dac
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 14:23:42.000000000', 'message': "Change ACL optmization strategy in the spec file

When we first wrote this design document, the strategy was to let
neutron-server work with old Address Sets and  create new Security
Groups modelled as Port Groups in OVN. However, that will make the
code unnecesarily complex and we should still provide a mechanism
to migrate from Address Sets to Port Groups.

This patch is changing the strategy by making sure that the migration
takes place upon neutron-server start if the underlying OVN schema
supports Port Groups. This way, neutron-server doesn't need to deal
with mixed modelled resources. The drawback is that we'll be delaying
a bit the start of neutron-server the first time we need to do the
migration but: 1) this will happen only once. 2) initial testing with
500 ports in 50 different networks with 5 SG rules takes around 8
seconds to migrate so it's reasonable.

Change-Id: I666a5ccc87101b559cd9ee4e95b7399d962e23fe
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Change ACL optmization strategy in the spec file

When we first wrote this design document, the strategy was to let
neutron-server work with old Address Sets and  create new Security
Groups modelled as Port Groups in OVN. However, that will make the
code unnecesarily complex and we should still provide a mechanism
to migrate from Address Sets to Port Groups.

This patch is changing the strategy by making sure that the migration
takes place upon neutron-server start if the underlying OVN schema
supports Port Groups. This way, neutron-server doesn't need to deal
with mixed modelled resources. The drawback is that we'll be delaying
a bit the start of neutron-server the first time we need to do the
migration but: 1) this will happen only once. 2) initial testing with
500 ports in 50 different networks with 5 SG rules takes around 8
seconds to migrate so it's reasonable.

Change-Id: I666a5ccc87101b559cd9ee4e95b7399d962e23fe
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use the multinode-os-net-config configs

The OpenShift + OpenStack deployments requires os-net-config data to be
present in the nodes to properly configure the OpenShift DNS.

Change-Id: I2467359cee613fa21cc0433e12652bd6468be380

commit_message:
Support same projects in different domain

Getting 500 error when there are same project name
in different domain.
Selecting one domain from service_credentials.
e.g. services(or service) projects are in default and service_domain
having differrent id. so this selects default's services project
instead of service_domain's services project

Change-Id: I3f12811684a49794bca87c4a10b18d45879da773
Closes-Bug: #1776375

commit_message:
Moving arguments(name,type) to mandatory section.

This patch is for the attributes [name,type] which were mandatory
options but showing in  optional attributes.Now name and type
attributes is changed to mandatory attributes.

Co-Authored-By: Deepak Mourya <deepak.mourya@india.nec.com>
Change-Id: I583ba4999558da7db833b2834f435b7f5f460c94
Related-Bug:#1743979

commit_message:
libvirt: Handle LM rollback error when detaching volumes from transient domain

When rolling back a live migration an attempt is made to detach volumes
from the destination domain before any underlying volumes are
disconnected. This will fail if the migration did not complete
resulting in the destination domain still being transient and as a
result unable to detach devices.

This change simply catches this error and ensures the call to disconnect
the underlying volume from the destination host is still made. As
MIN_LIBVIRT_VERSION is 1.3.1 this change also handles both the < 1.3.3
and >= 1.3.3 versions of the error string associated with detaching
devices from a transient domain.

Closes-Bug: #1779300
Change-Id: I716ecaa7b31e7131dafddcc652366652577845e1

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because of that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I76eced31caad9ac6a3bf3a71d1d08f51a4fdb75b

commit_message:
Undercloud specific volumes for mistral-executor container

This fixes the issue where the nova config was being mounted into the
mistral-executor, even though that is only needed for the undercloud.

The second parameter MistralExecutorExtraVolumes is provided so that
users can provide their own extra mounts without overwriting
MistralExecutorVolumes.

Once this mechanism lands, it can also be used to mount the extra
directories which CI needs to modify container images during
deployment, therefor this change is part of

Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow
Change-Id: I88612465d87f24a42e78e5f87a2d6b44b9335b11

commit_message:
Run cinder's db sync only on bootstrap node

The sync_db variable (which is True only on bootstrap node) needs to be
passed to the ::cinder::api resource to ensure the db sync only happens
on the bootstrap node.

Closes-Bug: #1779112
Change-Id: Ib7fcafbe769aadfcc58323ba3a06fa28a80a488a
(cherry picked from commit 34810fc361e71cfabe5d8ad6e083c664af9120e8)
(cherry picked from commit 690bf10462d2ac922e8c22631320e359cba9698f)
Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/cinder/api.pp
	spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_cinder_api_spec.rb

  - port: is translated to port_id=port['id']
  - client: is used to create/delete returned floating IP
  - **kwargs: are forwarded as they are to client

- It deletes floating IPs on final cleanup even when created
  by other client than default one.

commit_message:
It allows to create floating IPs with parameters.

- It adds missing parameters to create_floatingip method:
  - port: is translated to port_id=port['id']
  - client: is used to create/delete returned floating IP
  - **kwargs: are forwarded as they are to client

- It deletes floating IPs on final cleanup even when created
  by other client than default one.

- It implements delete_floatingip method.

- It deprecates create_and_associate_floatingip and replace
  it with create_floatingip

Change-Id: I6588e09127ab76c972d690a728fb7c5bad77289c

commit_message:
Set compute-feature-enabled.attach_encrypted_volume to False

* Currently python-tempestconf is going to heavy refactoring.
  In master, setting compute-feature-enabled.attach_encrypted_volume
  is handled by tempestconf but in Queens and pike tempestconf-1.4 and
  1.3 is used which does not have the same feature and this review
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570159/ removed the same for all
  releases causing tech-debt, It will fix the issue.

* Earlier all volume_encrypted tests are skipped, it fixes the issue.
  as it requires barbican support, few jobs does not barbican.

Change-Id: Ic8a29694fdfa3bebc1c9094a25235c72b1412da3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 16:46:13.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ie7fa610fa9de2be9d700217655c967ac9f404b3a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ie7fa610fa9de2be9d700217655c967ac9f404b3a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Skydive: Update Keystone and Neutron configuration

Skydive recently splitted the OpenStack configuration:
one for the authentication - on the analyzer - 'auth.keystone'
and an other one for the Neutron probe on the agent
'agent.topology.neutron'.

Change-Id: Idce277d30f01e7a36499b1aee24c54779c54a807

Do we have any testing for AZs? This seems like a fundamental problem with AZ support in Trove.'}, {'account_id': 8214, 'date': '2015-01-22 18:56:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

it seems possible that this would break a deployment that has a single az for cinder, but multiple azs for nova; yet, your commit message suggests that this is impossible.

i don't see this restriction documented anywhere. if possible, can you point me to the cinder logic that prevents this behavior (that, or documentation detailing this limitation)?"}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2015-01-22 19:49:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)

I'm not sure I understand why someone would want to attach a volume in a different AZ. Wouldn't one prefer to have the instance and the volume in the same AZ?

I don't see this as a bug but rather as an enhancement without a particularly good rationale provided other than that cinder has a parameter and we want to use it."}, {'account_id': 8415, 'date': '2015-01-28 13:39:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Amrith, answering your question, in multi-zone env there's a default AZ ('nova' for example), and when user wan't to deploy replica in defferent AZ instance provisioning fails since cinder tries to use default AZ that differs from requested AZ, that's the problem."}, {'account_id': 7806, 'date': '2015-02-03 02:36:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8415, 'date': '2015-02-03 13:19:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-02-03 14:40:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Any updates on Auston's question above?"}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2015-02-09 13:31:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

OK, I'm unsure why this problem is now surfacing itself. the az parameter has existed in cinder even in their v1 api. we currently use the v2 api.

Continuing on Auston's line of thinking, what has changed now that makes this fail? Why would we attempt to create a volume in one AZ and attach it to a Nova instance in another AZ?

In reviewing the bug I don't see that this problem was actually encountered. Am I correct in assuming that this problem was discovered by inspection of the code?

I suggest that this change should not merge till we understand for sure what it is we are really fixing here. Yes, passing the AZ parameter sounds like a good thing but what could it break?"}, {'account_id': 8415, 'date': '2015-02-09 21:37:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Amrith, let's take a look at multi-AZ deployment. So, it meanst that default AZ would be defined at least in Nova (for example zone A).

So, when user wants to create an instance with volume in zone B, and when he tries to do that through Trove it gets an error because Cinder doesn't have default zone (see http://docs.openstack.org/juno/config-reference/content/section_cinder.conf.html and https://github.com/openstack/python-cinderclient/blob/master/cinderclient/v2/volumes.py#L171). So Trove must explicitly say that instance and volume should be scheduled in one availablity zone."}, {'account_id': 8415, 'date': '2015-03-03 07:46:45.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 26472, 'date': '2018-07-06 06:24:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

+1'}]

commit_message:
Enable single-AZ provisioning for compute instance and block storage

Reasons:
 - Cinder doesn't allow to attach volume that was provisioned in
   different AZ that differs from compute instance AZ.

Changes:
 - add availability_zone attribute to volume.create call
 - add availability_zone to fake Cinder implementation

Change-Id: I0c6a3f5971db344466ce59fad7e0bbb2c88d3312
Closes-Bug: #1395016

commit_message:
Fix ambiguity around releases and workarounds

Note speaks of two workarounds, but only one is listed (unless
upgrade is considered workaround).

Also rocky is not released yet, so cannot be a recommended action
operators can take in thd moment of time.

This patch is just to fine tune the above, the rest looks good
though.

Change-Id: I931c5737d6e0a6ed5ae912693bad6b49438c80e1

commit_message:
Introduce ipvsadm to the amphora image

This patch adds the "ipvsadm" tool to the amphora image.

Change-Id: I7ccf823cae3dbd57dc3f40aec66629e27e5db98b

[{'created': '2018-06-06 21:21:35.000000000', 'message': 'replace windows line endings with unix line endings

pep8/flake8 complains under python 3 about the windows line endings in
these files. This change should merely change the line endings to use
the unix standard of \n instead of the windows standard of \r\n.

Change-Id: I5f4722b89964558b46cab3a3a6368d8b6c1f7c4a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
replace windows line endings with unix line endings

pep8/flake8 complains under python 3 about the windows line endings in
these files. This change should merely change the line endings to use
the unix standard of \n instead of the windows standard of \r\n.

Change-Id: I5f4722b89964558b46cab3a3a6368d8b6c1f7c4a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Allow configuration of NFS backend for Nova

Allow NFS configuration of storage backend for Nova.
This way the instances files will be stored on a shared
NFS storage.

Implements: bp tripleo-nova-nfs

Change-Id: Id15aec6324814a871e87f19f24999b0e3b8a8f05
(cherry picked from commit 5eee00d1ccf0c287fc4c4b81570b9f4f8cb73f3e)

commit_message:
Only install contextlib2 on python2

contextlib2 is a backport library for providing features in python2 from
python3. It's only used in 2 places, futurist and taskflow. In both
cases, there is already an try/except to use the native python3 version
instead.

Add environment markers so that we only install it when we need to.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/580482
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/574371
Change-Id: I4a0554d05158a44d28060bf6d7b1b5f30f0c8302

commit_message:
Support check replace stack credential

Refresh context with stack credential if any. A stack credential
is a Barbican Secret ID. The secret payload must content a string
which contain a json format dictionary. In dictionary, contains
following keys:
* auth: a dictionary to store authentication information.(It's
same configuration way as in clouds.yaml, see [1] and [2] for more
detail on format)
* auth_type: A string to show auth_type of above auth info
(see [2] for more information).
* roles: A list of roles to access with.
* project_id: project id to access with.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/python-openstackclient/latest/
configuration/index.html#clouds-yaml
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/keystoneauth/latest/plugin-options.html

Story: #2002126

Change-Id: I7add81b8d74b181164161cbb92b658a0306cf8e9

subject: Add Stack Credential DB
messages:
[{'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-06-27 13:54:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-27 18:05:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

We never want to store user secrets in the database. Castellan or nothing. (Preferably nothing.)'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-06-29 09:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-06-29 13:30:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Sorry about the mislead from tests but don't worry, we will never store any user credential, we only store secret ID and stack ID. That's all"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-29 14:08:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Why couldn't this go in the existing ResourceData table?"}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-07-01 17:05:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

ideally, where ever we can store stack_id(a String(36) column), and credential_secret_id(a String(36) column) all works for me. Just better keep it lightweight
ResourceData set require Foreign key `resource.id` which we didn't have, so might not be a perfect fit for us."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-07-02 15:18:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I haven't read the rest of the patches yet and I don't understand the use case at (i.e. I'm not convinced we even need to store the credential ID). That said, why can't we just do:

  self.resource_id_set(<stack_id>)
  self.data_set('credential_id', <credential_id>)

like we would for any other resource?

Is there code where we're searching in the database for the credential ID given the stack ID, outside the context of the resource that's managing the remote stack? Why would we be doing anything at all outside the context of the resource? It's not a nested stack, it's just another external resource that has no particular special meaning for Heat.

Creating a whole new database table is the most heavyweight approach possible."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-07-03 03:48:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-07-03 12:52:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

This table is not used in context or resource. I think I'm not making the usage of this table clear,
the current flow are: 
A resource(OS::Heat::Stack) to create a Stack -> A stack created in remote site -> Store that stack_id with a credential id in DB(here)

When update the resource (OS::Heat::Stack) -> update stack started in remote site -> Stack read DB with it's own id and get the credential -> use that credential to refresh context. You can see the usage from service.py in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578392/4/heat/engine/service.py line 2384"}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-07-05 15:31:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

gonna abandon this part'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-07-06 03:51:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Appear this path is not in flavor for team. abandon it
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23heat/%23heat.2018-07-05.log.html#t2018-07-05T15:03:52'}]

commit_message:
Add Stack Credential DB

Add Stack Credential DB schema, DB API, and DB migrate script.
Stack Credential will be used to store a barbican secret ID
which will be used to access to this remote stack. Stack Credential
will be stored when create stack(by remote stack resource), and can
be replaced when update stack with credential. For non-create stack
actions, Stack will try to find credential from DB and refresh
context with it if founded.

Story: #2002126

Change-Id: I3f841e706b41d1853c73e1453f31d51c34ced1df

allocated_capacity_gb should not be reported by drivers and let the
volume manager handle this.

Change-Id: Ief53a578f96384ab945598b4a67337dd8b8349f8

commit_message:
Fix prophetstor drivers report value

allocated_capacity_gb should not be reported by drivers and let the
volume manager handle this.

Change-Id: Ief53a578f96384ab945598b4a67337dd8b8349f8
Closes-Bug: #1746221
Signed-off-by: Kien Ha <kienha9922@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Iptables firewall driver adds forward rules for trusted ports

Iptables firewall driver can now add process trusted ports and
adds rules for them to FORWARD chain.

Change-Id: I67d0f17b4b56671fc2e2dd6e2fc4518dc42cd131
Closes-Bug: #1720205
(cherry picked from commit 97b30494a9263db684e5901113b53c25e55d1854)

commit_message:
Fix the unit test error

1. What is the problem?

   the unit test can not pass.

2. What is the solution to the problem?

   add the segmentation_id to the subnet.

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle to realize the solution?

   no

Signed-off-by: song baisen <songbaisen@szzt.com.cn>

Change-Id: I023a46af393b94cc3c4f2ec9f5636e740fa12224
Co-Authored-By: tangzhuo <ztang@hnu.edu.cn>, zhiyuan_cai <luckyvega.g@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 17:14:08.000000000', 'message': 'improve the error messages in the requirements check job

The phrasing and formatting of the existing messages makes it hard for
users unfamiliar with the requirements management process to
understand what is wrong. This change tries to make the messages
clearer, removes an overly verbose error message, and adds a message
to handle the case where something is missing from the global list
entirely.

Change-Id: I40711bf53aac52d534a427f4bdd1a91c20106118
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
improve the error messages in the requirements check job

The phrasing and formatting of the existing messages makes it hard for
users unfamiliar with the requirements management process to
understand what is wrong. This change tries to make the messages
clearer, removes an overly verbose error message, and adds a message
to handle the case where something is missing from the global list
entirely.

Change-Id: I40711bf53aac52d534a427f4bdd1a91c20106118
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add testresources / testscenarios to requirements.txt

oslo.db is consumed by the test suites of downstream libraries
as a test dependency; they make use of the oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_fixtures
module which imports testresources and testscenarios, therefore
these are normal requirements of oslo.db; they are not limited
to test requirements.

Change-Id: I240fbc28ddf238614ff37e742a1415a5566bcd2d
Closes-bug: #1756352

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I1b5bd8a53d0f93b99dd60fd5711a60f1135bcc4c

sure why not?

I like this:

    ubuntu@saio:/vagrant/.scratch$ swift-ring-builder zipped.composite 
    Ring Builder file is invalid: zipped.composite (it appears to be a composite ring builder file?)

better than this:

    ubuntu@saio:/vagrant/.scratch$ swift-ring-builder zipped.composite 
    Ring Builder file is invalid: zipped.composite
    'zipped.composite' appears to be a composite ring builder file

I might give a go at fixing up tests, but ... yawn

    diff --git a/swift/cli/ringbuilder.py b/swift/cli/ringbuilder.py
    index eae3b5f..b080807 100644
    --- a/swift/cli/ringbuilder.py
    +++ b/swift/cli/ringbuilder.py
    @@ -1260,13 +1260,13 @@ def main(arguments=None):
         try:
             builder = RingBuilder.load(builder_file)
         except exceptions.UnPicklingError as e:
    -        print(e)
    +        msg = str(e)
             try:
                 CompositeRingBuilder.load(builder_file)
    -            print('%r appears to be a composite ring builder file' %
    -                  builder_file)
    +            msg += ' (it appears to be a composite ring builder file?)'
             except Exception:  # noqa
                 pass
    +        print(msg)
             exit(EXIT_ERROR)
         except (exceptions.FileNotFoundError, exceptions.PermissionError) as e:
             if len(argv) < 3 or argv[2] not in('create', 'write_builder'):"}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2017-06-22 17:58:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2017-06-22 18:10:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
swift-ring-builder shows hint about composite builder file

If swift-ring-builder is erroneously given a composite builder
file, which it will fail to load, it will now print a hint
that the file is a composite builder file.

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Change-Id: If4517f3b61977a7f6ca3e08ed5deb182aa87a366

For DVR+HA:
When adding/removing a centralized fip, just add/remove it to/from
keepalived instance and do not check if it is a master router.

When adding a centralized fip, it is still needed to invoke method
of supperclass to configure nat rules on master node.

When removing a centralized fip, it is still needed to invoke method
of supperclass to clean contrack on master node.

Closes-Bug: #1736068
(cherry picked from commit 2200b1c3697a478af9f25a20ce09564bc2c9a968)

commit_message:
Add/rm centralized fips for DVR+HA from standby node

For DVR+HA:
When adding/removing a centralized fip, just add/remove it to/from
keepalived instance and do not check if it is a master router.

When adding a centralized fip, it is still needed to invoke method
of supperclass to configure nat rules on master node.

When removing a centralized fip, it is still needed to invoke method
of supperclass to clean contrack on master node.

Change-Id: I202db59acb7fb0b7924748cf7def2879a748e56a
Closes-Bug: #1736068
(cherry picked from commit 2200b1c3697a478af9f25a20ce09564bc2c9a968)

commit_message:
ensure the container_build_id is set

In locally run workflows the container_build_id is not set.
Ensure the var is set properly and is echo'd to the console
for transparency.

Closes-Bug: #1777896
Depends-On: I74c03ecaedaa8847c585814acf6249722b508dff
Change-Id: I138471bf07476fa174eca315cf6e4330d1ea65fa

commit_message:
Fix the messaging workflow name for the validations workflow.

The messaging workflow is wrong in the validations workflow,
thus all the validations are failing.

Change-Id: If632004063f2fedd6e925a0b22111d4d2e998c23
Closes-Bug: 1779884

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 04:15:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tempest compute feature for releases before rocky

Review [1] removed tempest config for all releases but
the patch [2] that added these parameters in python-tempestconf
is currently available only in rocky.
This patch fixes this param for older releases unless there
is plan to use the tempestconf patch in older releases as well.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570159/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570157/

Closes-Bug: #1779271
Change-Id: Id30e9cc7b237e09486c72d9fe2c1354814a3b993
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tempest compute feature for releases before rocky

Review [1] removed tempest config for all releases but
the patch [2] that added these parameters in python-tempestconf
is currently available only in rocky.
This patch fixes this param for older releases unless there
is plan to use the tempestconf patch in older releases as well.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570159/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570157/

Closes-Bug: #1779271
Change-Id: Id30e9cc7b237e09486c72d9fe2c1354814a3b993

commit_message:
Add creator role to tempest configuration in Pike

FS006 is failing tempest tests because of barbican is missing creator
role [1]. Let's add it to tempest configuration.

commit_message:
Iterate only once in network configs parameters

This re-orderes the parameters section of network config
templates. By doing this we reduce the number of times we
iterate over networks in the parameters section from
three times to once.

Change-Id: Id45c67b2c2b87fff5c557666a7959bfc0e49d36c

commit_message:
Execute post_update_tasks in update playbook

We drop the post_update_steps_playbook, and execute post_update_tasks
as part of the update_steps_playbook. This will ensure that
post_update_tasks are executed, and they're executed in accordance
with the `serial: 1` ordering that update_steps_playbook is using. (We
want to avoid an issue similar to what we've had in bug #1776206).

(cherry picked from commit 6b3e8aa073ca68fe600288b1dbb05dd384368d3b)
Change-Id: I15a984172cd5532bc966269d8c68f27b5703733e
Closes-Bug: #1778471

[{'created': '2018-06-21 09:29:19.000000000', 'message': "Make service check output more verbose.

Checks used to assert services' status post upgrade don't log
much on success or failure, for e.g:
  Waiting for haproxy pcs resource to start
  FAILURE: Haproxy pcs resource didn't get started after reboot
This change adds some extra info to be displayed to make
 troubleshooting easier.

Change-Id: I50ca550d225e52ba44b76a70b1db1c34088b88d7
"}]
commit_message:
Make service check output more verbose.

Checks used to assert services' status post upgrade don't log
much on success or failure, for e.g:
  Waiting for haproxy pcs resource to start
  FAILURE: Haproxy pcs resource didn't get started after reboot
This change adds some extra info to be displayed to make
 troubleshooting easier.

Change-Id: I50ca550d225e52ba44b76a70b1db1c34088b88d7

commit_message:
cover migration cases with functional tests

As we found multiple bugs in the server moving cases this patch adds
test to cover the migrate confirm and migrate revert cases as well.
It seems that these two cases work as expected.

Change-Id: I40a244601e1612a87bd41cd6ad652202035a1ce4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-24 13:28:00.000000000', 'message': '[Fullstack] Change time waiting for async ping results

During agents restart there is async ping run and there is
called function to wait until all async ping workers will
finish their job.

In TestHAL3Agent.test_ha_router_restart_agents_no_packet_lost
there are 60 pings sent with 1 second timeout so default
wait_until_true timeout which is set to 60 seconds might not
be enough in some cases.
Because of that wait_until_true timeout is now set as
twice higher value than is needed to number of packets to send
with ping_timeout.

This should give enough time to finish all workers.

Change-Id: Ia7c3755c2ba5029bdab3c1dd30b305f3bde19740
Closes-Bug: #1775183
(cherry picked from commit 32f14aa8a030e0d619ddd4989a3ea54a481f20e5)
(cherry picked from commit 9eef1db160521076d8243f1980e681f0f04ecbc6)
'}, {'created': '2018-06-24 13:29:42.000000000', 'message': '[Fullstack] Change time waiting for async ping results

During agents restart there is async ping run and there is
called function to wait until all async ping workers will
finish their job.

In TestHAL3Agent.test_ha_router_restart_agents_no_packet_lost
there are 60 pings sent with 1 second timeout so default
wait_until_true timeout which is set to 60 seconds might not
be enough in some cases.
Because of that wait_until_true timeout is now set as
twice higher value than is needed to number of packets to send
with ping_timeout.

This should give enough time to finish all workers.

Change-Id: Ia7c3755c2ba5029bdab3c1dd30b305f3bde19740
Closes-Bug: #1775183
(cherry picked from commit 32f14aa8a030e0d619ddd4989a3ea54a481f20e5)
'}]
commit_message:
[Fullstack] Change time waiting for async ping results

During agents restart there is async ping run and there is
called function to wait until all async ping workers will
finish their job.

In TestHAL3Agent.test_ha_router_restart_agents_no_packet_lost
there are 60 pings sent with 1 second timeout so default
wait_until_true timeout which is set to 60 seconds might not
be enough in some cases.
Because of that wait_until_true timeout is now set as
twice higher value than is needed to number of packets to send
with ping_timeout.

This should give enough time to finish all workers.

Change-Id: Ia7c3755c2ba5029bdab3c1dd30b305f3bde19740
Closes-Bug: #1775183
(cherry picked from commit 32f14aa8a030e0d619ddd4989a3ea54a481f20e5)

commit_message:
Use valid UUID in the placement gabbits

It seems gabbi does not resolve yaml refs in the URL part of a REST
call. This causes that the tests in ensure-consumer.yaml uses invalid
consumer id '*consumer_id'

This patches replace the *consumer_id with a fixture ref that works.

Change-Id: I0576f282b1801340db6827fb4c9520a0d48ad7f0
Related-Bug: #1780238
